channel.title: Underground House, Funk, Techno
channel.description: All underground electronic show, presented by Diplomatic Enjoy (Ireland). No pop, chart or major labels allowed! Sister to the “Underground” Spotify playlist series. Songs are DJ mixed live (as originally intended), focusing on one of house (deep, driving), funk (70s to modern) or techno (modern, innovative), or somewhere in between all 3. Featuring music from labels Phantasy, Stones Throw, Pampa, Mixmag, Resident Advisor, Dirtybird, Rhino and more. Variety and quality are key
channel.itunes:summary: Top shelf electronic music - all underground, no pop. Each monthly episode will be a DJ mix focusing on one of house(deep, driving), funk (70s to modern) or techno(modern, innovative music), or somewhere in between all 3. Hosted by Diplomatic Enjoy from Ireland - minimal talking! <--> Featuring music from labels such as Phantasy, Stones Throw, Ilian Tape, Kompakt, Pampa, Turbo, Mixmag, Dirtybird, Resident Advisor, Rhino, Soma and more. <--> Music played will also be available in streaming playlists on several platforms where available. <--> Mainstay artists such as James Brown, Madlib, Butch, J Dilla, Skee Mask, Daniel Avery, Carl Craig, Beastie Boys, Axel Boman, Moomin, Beck, Session Victim, Folamour and many more.
channel.itunes:author: Diplomatic Enjoy
channel.itunes:subtitle: Best in Underground music, mixed and hosted by Diplomatic Enjoy

item.title: Upbeat Neo Vinyl, Swimming Downstream, Underground House, EP11
item.description:
Upbeat Neo Vinyl, Swimming Downstream - Underground House, EP11

Hi I'm Pete Burquette, also known as Diplomatic Enjoy, and you are listening to the Underground House Funk n Techno podcast. The 1st song is by Session Victim called Never Forget on the Delusions of Grandeur label. I'll let the music take over the controls, back in a litte bit


  • ”Never Forget” by Session Victim on Delusions of Grandeur

  • ”Can't Die, Soul Singer…” by Diplomatic Enjoy

  • ”Lovelee Dae (Original)” by Blaze on Classic Music Company

  • ”Higher African Rhythms” by Diplomatic Enjoy

    • Lovelee Dae is a total house classic - is this the best house song of all time? This is the original mix not remastered or anything like that. There're been many mixes of this song, but it basically the original can't be improved on - bar the odd snippet edit I've done here, which doesn't really count as anything.

    There's just something about the melancholic singing, which beautifully juxtaposes the strident house beat beneath. This is a real 6am song, the sun coming up, grab the morning paper and a big dirty baguette sandwich.

    The song before this was Can't Die, Soul Singer by Diplomatic Enjoy and yes that is moi. I starting doing DJ mixes to begin with (not just a love of music, and because I was finding so much cool music) but also to white label try out my own tracks to see if I got it right.

    11th episode of this podcast, I finally got two that fit the bill. This white label approach is how pretty much all house n techno gets exercised, sitting amongst the classics seeing how it behaves.

    If anyone has any feedback on the podcast at all feel free to DM me at diplomaticenjoy on Instagram, let me know what you think. The next track is another white label, not out yet called, Higher African Rhythms but I could well change the name by the time I release it…


  • ”Trespassers” by Newworldaquarium on Delsin

  • ”Higher” by Black Loops on Neovinyl

  • ”Fresh” by Daft Punk on Soma/Virgin

    • This is of course Daft Punk from their legendary Homework album released on Soma and Virgin. Soma is the original Scottish label run by the lads from Slam, a techno duo.

    Before that was Higher by Black Loops on Neovinyl, a label who seem defunct at the moment. I say come back! I love the mastering that the Neovinyl guy Baldo does, he's done all the good Black Loops ones I M O.

    And before that again you heard another house classic Trespassers by Newworldaquarium, which brilliantly samples Sergio Mendes and the New Brasil 77 - "the Real thing".

    All these songs and songs like em are on the ever revolving "Underground House" playlist , I think I'm calling it "Underground House (black loops, moodymann, soul, funk" … a catchy name you're totally gonna remember. Not helped by the fact that I change the name all the time. It's the one with people at a festival on the cover.

    I think in order to be found through search on Spotify you need to be famous, but I completely forgot my famous badge on my tent. I'll go back and get it now

  • ”Casa(Axel Boman Dub Mix)” by Dinky on Crosstown Rebels

  • ”Not Seeing Is A Flower” by Lone on Ancient Astronauts

  • ”Verloren” by Computer Data on Lost Palms (a sub label of Shall Not Fade)

    • This is Verloren by Computer Data on Lost Palms label, which is a sub-label of Shall Not Fade. This in itself is a sub-label of Will Totally Shrink in the Wash. featuring I'm gonna have to lose some weight if I'm gonna fit into that again.

    Before that was Not Seeing a Flower by Lone on Ancient Astronauts. See the flower people, see the flower. Unless you're allergic to that kind of thing, in which case, avoid the flower completely.

    And before that was Axel Boman's Dub Mix of Dinky's Casa. That was released on Crosstown Rebels. I'm pretty sure that the vocal sample was that of everyone's favourite sketchy uncle, Timothy Leary, who consumed enough acid in his time to become his own planet and currently orbiting the sun at 55,000 miles an hour.


  • ”Back in the Days” by Coeo on Toy Tonics

  • ”Street Disco” by Lux Experience on Masterworks Music

  • ”Wan Poku Moro(Onur Ozer Remix)” by 2000 And One on 100% Pure

    • This is the Onur Ozer Remix of 2000 And One's "Wan Poku Moro" on 100% Pure.

    Before that was Street Disco by Lux Experience on Masterworks Music. Black Madonna made this song her own (I think it was a Boiler Room mix), although I notice no-one seems to mention the people who actually wrote the song originally, which was of course originally Disco Party in the Street by Mastermind.

    I love their edit here, it's simple but very effective. It's actually hard to tell the difference.

    Before that was Back in the Days by Coeo on Toy Tonics.

    And the final song coming up is Feeling Good by Laurent Garnier and Chambray on Rekids.


  • ”Feelin' Good” by Laurent Garnier and Chambray on Rekids

    • I just noticed I've never asked anyone to subscribe. I never quite understood the please subscribe thing. If people want to subscribe, they know how to do that, they don't need me telling them to press the button!

    I don't mind either way. As long as I don't know it's all good. Otherwise it's like leaving a dog in a car with the windows rolled up. Us podcast hosts need your attention, leave those windows rolled down so we can stick our heads out the window.

    Till next time people, have a beautiful day!


    Songs in this mix (or ones like them) can be found in the ”Underground House” playlist on Spotify, Youtube and Soundcloud

    Shenanigans:

  • Underground House on Spotify
  • Diplomatic Enjoy
  • Instagram
  • Soundcloud
  • Youtube House PL

item.title: Headphone Cloud Party, Boogie in Smallville - Underground House, EP10
item.description:
Headphone Cloud Party, Boogie in Smallville - Underground House, EP10

Hi this is Pete Burquette, aka Diplomatic Enjoy, rolling out the Underground House tent.

  • ”Aviator” by Jesper Ryom on Power Plant Records

  • ”High Energy” by Ross From Friends on Ostgut Ton

  • ”Got2B” by Move D on Hybrid Minds

  • ”Ya never know” by Moomin on Closer (which I think might be his own label?)

  • ”Orchid” by Dj Kush Boogie on Lobster Theremin

  • ”From Disco to disco” by Whirlpool Productions - this needs explanation! It sounds like they fired up the tape recorder after a serious night on the town that wasn't ending anytime soon

  • ”If you want it” by Park Hye Jin on Clipp.Art a cool little Australian label, I think they're Australian, maybe they're orbiting the Earth and distributing from there.

  • ”On my side” by Adryiano on Soul Notes

  • ”Ivoire” remixed by Folamour on Umami, original track is by Kio Amachree from 1981

  • ”Handsome Frank” by Oskar Offermann & Moomin by White, which is Oskar's Berlin label

  • ”Baustelle” by Black Loops on Neovinyl Recordings (a Barcelona-Berlin label)

  • ”Sixth Sense” by Josh Wink and Ursula Rucker, remixed by Louie Vega on Philadelphia's Ovum Recordings owned by Mr Wink and King Britt of Digable Planets.

  • ”Blazing” by Cubenx on Infiné

  • ”Last Home” by Yulia Niko on Rebellion

    • Songs in this mix (or ones like them) can be found in the ”Underground House” playlist on Spotify, Youtube, Soundcloud

    Shenanigans:

  • Underground House on Spotify
  • Diplomatic Enjoy
  • Soundcloud
  • Instagram
  • Youtube PL

item.title: Disco Social Clubbin Dirt Crew (Underground House, EP09)
item.description:
Disco Social Clubbin Dirt Crew (Underground House, EP09)

Hi this is Pete Burquette, also known as Diplomatic Enjoy, and this boy is Underground House.

1st track is called ”Fling Cleaning” by Junktion on the Razor n Tape label.

  • Black Loops called ”Suki” which is the Japanese for Like. Toy Tonic records.

  • ”She's All Right” by Paxton Fettel (APersonal)

  • ”Jubilee” by Lorenz Rhode (Dirt Crew Recordings). Jubilee is short for Jubilation Lee, one of the X-Men. Mutant. known to her friends as Jubes, or firecracker. she has the power to explode matter at a subatomic level, generating bursts of plasma. Good party trick

  • ”Times Get Tough” by the Revenge (Dirt Crew)

  • ”Roach Fingers” by Jesse Bru (Egoplanet)

  • ”Native Riddim” by Coeo (Toy Tonics), spelt in the Jamaican stylee, presumably they wrote that sweltering in the heat, lolling in a hammock

  • ”All the Reasons” by Sweely (Distant Hawaii)

  • ”Work Out Right” by The Revenge (Dirt Crew)

  • ”Queens Bridge” by Borrowed Identity (Lumberjacks in Hell)

  • ”Groove On” by Borrowed Identity (Tenderpark)

  • ”Love U Mama” by Maceo Plex (Crosstown Rebels), the weather is fine and there is a build in 5k frequencies

  • ”Music People” - Moodymann (Moodymann) based on a sample of Mass Production's ”Welcome to our World” and ”Original Disco Motion” by Faze Action

  • ”9:15” by Hnny (Yummy)

    • Songs in this mix (or ones like them) can be found in the ”Underground House (Underground House (deep feels, funk, electronic Soul))” playlist on Spotify, Youtube, Soundcloud

    Cover is a festival near you

    Shenanigans:

  • Underground House on Spotify
  • Diplomatic Enjoy
  • Soundcloud
  • Instagram
  • Youtube PL

item.title: Afro chill Vibes, Hip hop brainFeeder crates - Underground Funk
item.description:
EP 08. Funk and Hip hop this episode…

Welcome to episode 8 of Underground House, Funk n Techno podcast, I'm Pete Burquette, this is Underground Funk.

Got 23 funk and hip hop tunes, of which there are 10 edits, 4 remixes and 1 unreleased track.  All new spins …

  • Them Changes - Thundercat (Brainfeeder) (DE Edit)

  • Do It - Beastie Boys (Grand Royal Records)

  • Chilled. by Speechless (Speak less, Listen More)

  • In Flux by DJ Shadow (Island Records) (DE Edit) - Released before ”Endtroducing” was released, set the template. I'm playing an edited down, sped up version of it, as the original is 12 minute long epic, more for home listening and space travel, and is really good.

  • Stepping Into Tomorrow - Madlib (Blue Note Records) (DE Edit) - classic ”Shades of Blue” album. I've done a DJ edit of it here, but the song itself is a reworking of Donald Byrd's 1974 song of the same name.

  • Erykahs Gun - DJ Harrison Stashboxxx album on Ropedope label

  • Just Kissed My Baby - The Meters (DE Remix) Rhino, Reprise, Warner Records (and other record labels too). It's the Meters, so it's like trying to find a source for the Bible … in this case, of FUNK

  • Cabaceira BY FloFilz (Melting Pot Records)

  • While You Doooo - Teebs (Brainfeeder records)

  • Vibrations - Al Dobson Jr. (Rhythm Section International)

  • Break - Jurassic 5 (Interscope Records) From the classic Power In Numbers album

  • You've Heard - Daedelus (All City Records from Dublin, Ireland) (DE Edit)

  • Hell Yes - Beck (Interscope) on Guero album (DE Edit)

  • Wider, Git Hub - Ratgrave who are Max Graef, Julius Conrad (Apron Records)

  • Do It (till you're satisfied) by B.T. Express (Roadshow Records) (DE Remix)

  • Beatless Reunion - Diplomatic Enjoy Unreleased track by me. Actually made to have a beatless start and end for an earlier version of this mix, like a mix tool, but ended up doing the mix differently but still keeping the track in

  • B Boys Will B Boys - Black Star (Rawkus Entertainment) (DE Edit).

  • Bubble and Slide (Nightmares on Wax Remix of Sabres of Paradise (DE Edit) on Warp Records

  • Jazz 104 by Max Graef (Tartelet Records) (DE Edit). Jazz 104 is a reworking of ”Popular Instruments” by Paul Parrish and James Lansing sound, a cool find, where I think this is the drummer of Bread on a hi-fidelity system demonstration record, which I think used to come with the 1st component home stereo systems! I combined both of these tracks so there's a drum intro, so that I could then DJ blend.

  • Party Pts 1 and 2 - Midnight Movers from their Follow The Wind album on Buddah Records. This is a lost classic where no version exists of this on Spotify and no good vinyl copies exist anywhere, so I was lucky to be able to pull a remix out of it by playing a new bass, drum parts, etc while keeping as much of the original as possible. I almost gave up, but I think has ended up being the edit or remix I like the most.

  • Beep It by Japanese legend Cornelius from his/their 'Sensuous' album (DE Edit). I saw these play live in Sydney, Australia, a while back, they were excellent.

  • Power to the People - Public Enemy (Def Jam Recordings) (DE Remix) This is basically the instrumental version of Power to the People with extra percussion added in, different mastering, it's kind of a remix. The original is on the deluxe version of Fear of a Black Planet, which if you like Public Enemy has lots of little intrumentals and alternative versions, all of which stand well on their own right because of the Bomb Squad's, PE's production team, ”wall of samples” production approach.

    • Songs in this mix (or ones like them) can be found in the ”Underground Funk (Afro soul, 70s, beats, breaks, stones Throw)” playlist on Spotify, Youtube, Soundcloud and Deezer

    Cover is Mr. Sly Stone

    More shenanigans and related treats can be found at:

  • Underground Funk on Spotify
  • Diplomatic Enjoy
  • Soundcloud
  • Instagram
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
item.content:encoded:
EP 08. Funk and Hip hop this episode…

Welcome to episode 8 of Underground House, Funk n Techno podcast, I'm Pete Burquette, this is Underground Funk.

Got 23 funk and hip hop tunes, of which there are 10 edits, 4 remixes and 1 unreleased track.  All new spins …

  • Them Changes - Thundercat (Brainfeeder) (DE Edit)

  • Cabaceira BY FloFilz (Melting Pot Records)

  • Break - Jurassic 5 (Interscope Records) From the classic Power In Numbers album

  • You've Heard - Daedelus (All City Records from Dublin, Ireland) (DE Edit)

  • Hell Yes - Beck (Interscope) on Guero album (DE Edit)

  • Wider, Git Hub - Ratgrave who are Max Graef, Julius Conrad (Apron Records)

  • Do It (till you're satisfied) by B.T. Express (Roadshow Records) (DE Remix)

  • Beatless Reunion - Diplomatic Enjoy Unreleased track by me. Actually made to have a beatless start and end for an earlier version of this mix, like a mix tool, but ended up doing the mix differently but still keeping the track in

  • B Boys Will B Boys - Black Star (Rawkus Entertainment) (DE Edit).

  • Bubble and Slide (Nightmares on Wax Remix of Sabres of Paradise (DE Edit) on Warp Records

  • Jazz 104 by Max Graef (Tartelet Records) (DE Edit). Jazz 104 is a reworking of ”Popular Instruments” by Paul Parrish and James Lansing sound, a cool find, where I think this is the drummer of Bread on a hi-fidelity system demonstration record, which I think used to come with the 1st component home stereo systems! I combined both of these tracks so there's a drum intro, so that I could then DJ blend.

  • Party Pts 1 and 2 - Midnight Movers from their Follow The Wind album on Buddah Records. This is a lost classic where no version exists of this on Spotify and no good vinyl copies exist anywhere, so I was lucky to be able to pull a remix out of it by playing a new bass, drum parts, etc while keeping as much of the original as possible. I almost gave up, but I think has ended up being the edit or remix I like the most.

  • Beep It by Japanese legend Cornelius from his/their 'Sensuous' album (DE Edit). I saw these play live in Sydney, Australia, a while back, they were excellent.

  • Power to the People - Public Enemy (Def Jam Recordings) (DE Remix) This is basically the instrumental version of Power to the People with extra percussion added in, different mastering, it's kind of a remix. The original is on the deluxe version of Fear of a Black Planet, which if you like Public Enemy has lots of little intrumentals and alternative versions, all of which stand well on their own right because of the Bomb Squad's, PE's production team, ”wall of samples” production approach.

    • Songs in this mix (or ones like them) can be found in the ”Underground Funk (Afro soul, 70s, beats, breaks, stones Throw)” playlist on Spotify, Youtube, Soundcloud and Deezer

    Cover is Mr. Sly Stone

    More shenanigans and related treats can be found at:

  • Underground Funk on Spotify
  • Diplomatic Enjoy
  • Soundcloud
  • Instagram
  • Facebook
  • Twitter

item.title: Stones throw, 70s breaks, Tape style beats (Underground Funk)
item.description:
Stones Throw, 70s Breaks, Tape Style Beats (Underground Funk)

Underground Funk pt 2, Stones Throw vs 70s flavor. Chunky beats, 70s funk, modern breaks, edits, quasi-remixes – keeping as stanky as I can. Your host is Diplomatic Enjoy aka Pete Burquette. Minimal talking – DJ mix focus. Episode 5 in the UHFT series…

Music From: Beastie Boys, DJ Harrison, A Tribe Called Quest, Cornershop, Roberta Flack, Boards of Canada, Stereolab, J Rocc, Karriem Riggins, Jonwayne, Kiefer, Slum Village, J Dilla, Ramsey Lewis, The Perfect Circle, James Brown, The Everyday People, Mighty Ryeders, Samuel Jonathan Johnson, Public Enemy, Cymande and Sir Joe Quarterman & Free Soul

Songs from this mix(and others like ’em) can be found on the “Underground Funk” playlist, which can be found here: https://spoti.fi/2GXHpDa

Cover image: Karriem Riggins

More shenanigans and related treats can be found at:

  • Underground Funk on Spotify
  • Diplomatic Enjoy
  • Soundcloud
  • Instagram
  • Facebook
  • Twitter

item.title: Underground Funk – 70s style, breaks vibe
item.description:
Underground Funk – 70s Style, Breaks Vibe

Underground Funk – All party zone funk, mostly from the 70s, with a modern Stones Throw like twist. Laid back weekends, fire hydrants in the heat, the bump and the bounce. EP02 – host: Diplomatic Enjoy.

More in this mix at https://diplomaticenjoy.com, the Underground Funk playlist, https://instagram.com/diplomaticenjoy.

Music from The Isley Brothers, The Blackbyrds, William DeVaughn, Gil Scott Heron, James Brown, Rare Earth, Up, Bustle and Out, Bumps(from Stones Throw ), Sir Joe Quarterman, Free Soul, Midnight Movers, Incredible Bongo Band and Hamilton Bohannon

More shenanigans and related treats can be found at:

  • Underground Funk on Spotify
  • Diplomatic Enjoy
  • Soundcloud
  • Instagram
  • Facebook
  • Twitter

item.title: Underground House – Deep house to techno tinged
item.description:
Underground House – Deep House to Techno Tinged

Episode 1. From Deep House to house with a Techno influence. Peaks aplenty! Mixed live on a Xone 92 / Pioneer setup. Hosted by Diplomatic Enjoy and a flock of geese.

Music from Motor City Drum Ensemble, TRP, Fouk, Julio Bashmore, Maceo Plex, LCD Soundsystem, Silicone Soul, DJ Q, Underworld, Soul of Man, Ricardo Villalobos, Walker and Royce

Labels such as Lobster Theremin, Heist, PMR Records, Smalltown Supersound, Dirtybird, Delicacies, Not On Label, Curle, Filter and Finger Lickin’.

Next month will have a funk focus, unless they are any geese-related incidents in the interim…

More shenanigans and related treats can be found at:

  • Underground House on Spotify
  • Diplomatic Enjoy
  • Soundcloud
  • Instagram
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
